18746.text: /Look, you will call a nation you don’t know,/_a nation you don’t know will run to you/_because of the Lord your God,/_the holy one of Israel, who has glorified you.

18747.text: ¶Seek the Lord when he can still be found;/_call him while he is yet near.

18748.text: /Let the wicked abandon their ways/_and the sinful their schemes./Let them return to the Lord so that he may have mercy on them,/_to our God, because he is generous with forgiveness.

18749.text: /My plans aren’t your plans,/nor are your ways my ways, says the Lord.

18750.text: /Just as the heavens are higher than the earth,/_so are my ways higher than your ways,/_and my plans than your plans.

18751.text: /Just as the rain and the snow come down from the sky/_and don’t return there without watering the earth,/_making it conceive and yield plants/_and providing seed to the sower and food to the eater,

18752.text: /_so is my word that comes from my mouth;/_it does not return to me empty./_Instead, it does what I want,/_and accomplishes what I intend.

18753.text: ¶Yes, you will go out with celebration,/_and you will be brought back in peace./Even the mountains and the hills will burst into song before you;/_all the trees of the field will clap their hands.

18754.text: /In place of the thorn the cypress will grow;/_in place of the nettle the myrtle will grow./This will attest to the Lord’s stature,/_an enduring reminder that won’t be removed.

18755.text: §¶The Lord says:/_Act justly and do what is righteous,/_because my salvation is coming soon,/_and my righteousness will be revealed.

18756.text: /Happy is the one who does this,/_the person who holds it fast,/_who keeps the Sabbath, not making it impure,/_and avoids doing any evil.

18757.text: ¶Don’t let the immigrant who has joined with the Lord say,/_“The Lord will exclude me from the people.”/_And don’t let the eunuch say,/_“I’m just a dry tree.”

18758.text: /The Lord says:/_To the eunuchs who keep my sabbaths,/_choose what I desire,/_and remain loyal to my covenant.

18759.text: /_In my temple and courts, I will give them/_a monument and a name better than sons and daughters./_I will give to them an enduring name/_that won’t be removed.

18760.text: /The immigrants who have joined me,/_serving me and loving my name, becoming my servants,/_everyone who keeps the Sabbath without making it impure,/_and those who hold fast to my covenant:

18761.text: /_I will bring them to my holy mountain,/_and bring them joy in my house of prayer./_I will accept their entirely burned offerings and sacrifices on my altar./_My house will be known as a house of prayer for all peoples,

18762.text: /_says the Lord God,/_who gathers Israel’s outcasts./I will gather still others to those I have already gathered.

18763.text: §¶All you beasts of the field,/_come and eat, all you beasts of the forest!

18764.text: /The lookouts are blind;/_they all lack sense./They are all mute dogs that can’t bark,/_dreamers, loungers, loving to sleep.

18765.text: /But the dogs have monstrous appetites./_They never have enough./_They are shepherds who don’t understand./All of them have turned to their own ways,/_every last one greedy for profit.

18766.text: /“Come! I’ll get some wine!/_Let’s drink beer!/_Tomorrow will be like today, or even much better.”

18767.text: ¶The righteous person perishes,/_and no one takes it to heart./Loyal people are gathered together,/_and no one understands that because of evil/_the righteous one passed away.

18768.text: /They will find peace;/_those who walk in straight paths/_will find rest on their burial beds.

18769.text: §¶Come here, you children of sorcery,/_offspring of adultery and prostitution!

18770.text: /Whom are you mocking?/_Against whom do you open your mouth wide/_and stick out your tongue?/Aren’t you children of rebellion, offspring of lies,

18771.text: /_who console yourselves with idols under every green tree,/_who slaughter children in the valleys, under the rocky cliffs?

18772.text: /You belong with the smooth talkers in the valley;/_they, they are your lot./For them you poured out a drink offering,/_and presented a grain offering./_Should I condone these things?

18773.text: /On a very high mountain you made your bed./_You went up there to offer a sacrifice.

18774.text: /Behind the door and the doorpost/_you placed your symbols./You abandoned me and lay down,/_making room in your bed/_and making deals for yourself with them./You loved their bed;/_you saw their nakedness.

18775.text: /You went down to Molech with oil,/_and you slathered on your ointments;/_you sent your messengers far away,/_sent them down to the underworld.

18776.text: /Worn out by all your efforts,/_yet you wouldn’t say, “This is useless.”/You found new strength;/_therefore, you weren’t tired.

18777.text: /Whom did you dread and fear so that you lied,/_didn’t remember me or give me a thought?/Isn’t it because I was silent and closed my eyes/_that you stopped fearing me?

18778.text: /I will bring evidence about your righteousness and your actions;/_they won’t help you.

18779.text: /When you cry out,/_let those things you’ve gathered save you!/The wind will lift them all;/_one breath will take them away./but those taking refuge in me will inherit the land and possess my holy mountain.

18780.text: §¶It will be said: “Survey, survey; build a road!/_Remove barriers from my people’s road!”

18781.text: /The one who is high and lifted up,/_who lives forever, whose name is holy, says:/I live on high, in holiness,/_and also with the crushed and the lowly,/_reviving the spirit of the lowly,/_reviving the heart of those who have been crushed.

18782.text: /I won’t always accuse,/_nor will I be enraged forever./_It is my own doing that their spirit is exhausted—/_I gave them breath!

18783.text: /I was enraged about their illegal profits;/_I struck them; in rage I withdrew from them./Yet they went on wandering wherever they wanted.

18784.text: /_I have seen their ways, but I will heal them./_I will guide them,/_and reward them with comfort./And for those who mourn,

18785.text: /_I will create reason for praise:/_utter prosperity to those far and near,/_and I will heal them, says the Lord.

18786.text: /But the wicked are like the churning sea that can’t keep still./_They churn up from their waters muck and mud.

18787.text: /_There is no peace, says my God, for the wicked.

18788.text: §¶Shout loudly; don’t hold back;/_raise your voice like a trumpet!/Announce to my people their crime,/_to the house of Jacob their sins.

18789.text: /They seek me day after day,/_desiring knowledge of my ways/_like a nation that acted righteously,/_that didn’t abandon their God./They ask me for righteous judgments,/_wanting to be close to God.

18790.text: /“Why do we fast and you don’t see;/_why afflict ourselves and you don’t notice?”/Yet on your fast day you do whatever you want,/_and oppress all your workers.

18791.text: /You quarrel and brawl, and then you fast;/_you hit each other violently with your fists./You shouldn’t fast as you are doing today/_if you want to make your voice heard on high.

18792.text: /Is this the kind of fast I choose,/_a day of self‑affliction,/_of bending one’s head like a reed/_and of lying down in mourning clothing and ashes?/_Is this what you call a fast,/_a day acceptable to the Lord?

18793.text: ¶Isn’t this the fast I choose:/_releasing wicked restraints, untying the ropes of a yoke,/_setting free the mistreated,/_and breaking every yoke?

18794.text: /Isn’t it sharing your bread with the hungry/_and bringing the homeless poor into your house,/_covering the naked when you see them,/_and not hiding from your own family?

18795.text: /Then your light will break out like the dawn,/_and you will be healed quickly./Your own righteousness will walk before you,/_and the Lord’s glory will be your rear guard.

18796.text: /Then you will call, and the Lord will answer;/_you will cry for help, and God will say, “I’m here.”/If you remove the yoke from among you,/_the finger‑pointing, the wicked speech;

18797.text: /_if you open your heart to the hungry,/_and provide abundantly for those who are afflicted,/_your light will shine in the darkness,/_and your gloom will be like the noon.

18798.text: /The Lord will guide you continually/_and provide for you, even in parched places./_He will rescue your bones./You will be like a watered garden,/_like a spring of water that won’t run dry.

18799.text: /They will rebuild ancient ruins on your account;/_the foundations of generations past you will restore./You will be called Mender of Broken Walls,/_Restorer of Livable Streets.

18800.text: ¶If you stop trampling the Sabbath,/_stop doing whatever you want on my holy day,/_and consider the Sabbath a delight,/_sacred to the Lord, honored,/_and honor it instead of doing things your way,/_seeking what you want and doing business as usual,

18801.text: /_then you will take delight in the Lord./_I will let you ride on the heights of the earth;/_I will sustain you with the heritage of your ancestor Jacob./_The mouth of the Lord has spoken.

18802.text: §¶Look! The Lord does not lack the power to save,/_nor are his ears too dull to hear,

18803.text: /_but your misdeeds have separated you from your God./Your sins have hidden his face from you/_so that you aren’t heard.

18804.text: /Your hands are stained with blood,/_and your fingers with guilt./Your lips speak lies;/_your tongues mutter malice.

18805.text: /No one sues honestly;/_no one pleads truthfully./By trusting in emptiness and speaking deceit,/_they conceive harm and give birth to malice.

18806.text: /They hatch adders’ eggs,/_and weave spiderwebs./Whoever eats their eggs will die./_Moreover, the crushed egg hatches a viper.

18807.text: /Their webs can’t serve as clothing;/_they can’t cover themselves with their deeds./Their deeds are deeds of malice,/_and the work of violence is in their hands.

18808.text: /Their feet run to evil;/_they rush to shed innocent blood./Their thoughts are thoughts of malice;/_desolation and destruction litter their highways.

18809.text: /They don’t know the way of peace;/_there’s no justice in their paths./They make their roads crooked;/_no one who walks in them knows peace.

18810.text: §¶Because of all this, justice is far from us,/_and righteousness beyond our reach./We expect light, and there is darkness;/_we await a gleam of light, but walk about in gloom.

18811.text: /We grope along the wall like the blind;/_like those without eyes we grope./We stumble at noonday as if it were twilight,/_and among the strong as if we were dying.

18812.text: /All of us growl like bears,/_and like doves we moan./We expect justice, but there is none;/_we await salvation, but it is far from us.

18813.text: /Our rebellions are numerous in your presence;/_our sins testify against us./Our rebellions are with us;/_we’re aware of our guilt:

18814.text: /_defying and denying the Lord,/_turning away from our God,/_planning oppression and revolt,/_muttering lying words conceived in our minds.

18815.text: /Justice is pushed aside;/_righteousness stands far off,/_because truth has stumbled in the public square,/_and honesty can’t enter.

18816.text: /Truth is missing;/_anyone turning from evil is plundered.§¶The Lord looked and was upset at the absence of justice.

18817.text: /Seeing that there was no one,/_and astonished that no one would intervene,/_God’s arm brought victory,/_upheld by righteousness,

18818.text: /_putting on righteousness as armor/_and a helmet of salvation on his head,/_putting on garments of vengeance,/_and wrapping himself in a cloak of zeal.

18819.text: /God will repay according to their actions:/_wrath to his foes, retribution to enemies,/_retribution to the coastlands,

18820.text: /_so those in the west will fear the Lord’s name,/_and those in the east will fear God’s glory./It will come like a rushing river/_that the Lord’s wind drives on.

18821.text: /A redeemer will come to Zion/_and to those in Jacob who stop rebelling,/_says the Lord.

18822.text: ¶As for me, this is my covenant with them, says the Lord./_My spirit, which is upon you,/_and my words, which I have placed in your mouth/_won’t depart from your mouth,/_nor from the mouths of your descendants,/_nor from the mouths of your descendants’ children,/_says the Lord,/_forever and always.

18823.text: §¶Arise! Shine! Your light has come;/_the Lord’s glory has shone upon you.

18824.text: /Though darkness covers the earth/_and gloom the nations,/_the Lord will shine upon you;/_God’s glory will appear over you.

18825.text: /Nations will come to your light/_and kings to your dawning radiance.

18826.text: ¶Lift up your eyes and look all around:/_they are all gathered; they have come to you./Your sons will come from far away,/_and your daughters on caregivers’ hips.

18827.text: /Then you will see and be radiant;/_your heart will tremble and open wide,/_because the sea’s abundance will be turned over to you;/_the nations’ wealth will come to you.

18828.text: /Countless camels will cover your land,/_young camels from Midian and Ephah./They will all come from Sheba,/_carrying gold and incense,/_proclaiming the Lord’s praises.

18829.text: /All Kedar’s sheep will be gathered for you;/_rams from Nebaioth will be your offerings;/_they will be accepted on my altar,/_and I will glorify my splendid house.

18830.text: ¶Who are these who fly like a cloud,/_like doves to their shelters?

18831.text: /I’m the hope of the coastlands./_Ships from Tarshish are in the lead/_to bring your children from afar,/_their silver and gold with them/_for the name of the Lord your God/_and for the holy one of Israel, who has glorified you.

18832.text: /Foreigners will rebuild your walls,/_and their kings will serve you./Though in my rage I struck you down,/_in my favor I have consoled you.

18833.text: /Your gates will be open continually;/_day and night they won’t close,/_to bring to you the wealth of nations,/_and their kings led in procession.

18834.text: /The nation and the dynasty/_that won’t serve you will perish;/_such nations will be devastated.

18835.text: /Lebanon’s glory will come upon you,/_cypress, elm, and pine,/_to glorify the site of my sanctuary,/_and I will honor my royal footstool.

18836.text: /The children of your tormenters will come bending low to you;/_all who despised you will bow down at your feet./They will call you The Lord’s City,/_Zion, of the holy one of Israel.

18837.text: /Instead of being abandoned,/_hated, and forbidden,/_I will make you majestic forever,/_a joy for all generations.

18838.text: /You will suck the milk of nations,/_and nurse at royal breasts./_You will know that I am the Lord, your savior/_and your redeemer, the mighty one of Jacob.

18839.text: /Instead of bronze I will bring gold;/_instead of iron I will bring silver;/_instead of wood, bronze;/_and instead of stones, iron./I will make peace your governor/_and righteousness your taskmaster.

18840.text: /Violence will no longer resound throughout your land,/_nor devastation or destruction within your borders./You will call your walls Salvation,/_and your gates Praise.

18841.text: /The sun will no longer be your light by day,/_nor will the moon shine for illumination by night./The Lord will be your everlasting light;/_your God will be your glory.

18842.text: /Your sun will no longer set;/_your moon will no longer wane./The Lord will be an everlasting light for you,/_and your days of mourning will be ended.

18843.text: /Your people will all be righteous;/_they will possess the land forever./They are the shoot that I planted,/_the work of my hands, to glorify myself.

18844.text: /The least will become a thousand,/_and the smallest a powerful people./I am the Lord; at the right moment, I will hurry it along.

18845.text: §¶The Lord God’s spirit is upon me,/_because the Lord has anointed me./He has sent me/_to bring good news to the poor,/_to bind up the brokenhearted,/_to proclaim release for captives,/_and liberation for prisoners,

18846.text: /_to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor/_and a day of vindication for our God,/_to comfort all who mourn,

18847.text: /_to provide for Zion’s mourners,/_to give them a crown in place of ashes,/_oil of joy in place of mourning,/_a mantle of praise in place of discouragement./They will be called Oaks of Righteousness,/_planted by the Lord to glorify himself.

18848.text: /They will rebuild the ancient ruins;/_they will restore formerly deserted places;/_they will renew ruined cities,/_places deserted in generations past.

18849.text: ¶Foreigners will stay and shepherd your sheep,/_and strangers will be your farmers and vinedressers.

18850.text: /You will be called The Priests of the Lord;/_Ministers of Our God, they will say about you./You will feed on the wealth of nations,/_and fatten yourself on their riches.

18851.text: /Instead of shame, their portion will be double;/_instead of disgrace, they will rejoice over their share./They will possess a double portion in their land;/_everlasting joy will be theirs.

18852.text: /I, the Lord, love justice;/_I hate robbery and dishonesty./I will faithfully give them their wage,/_and make with them an enduring covenant.

18853.text: /Their offspring will be known among the nations,/_and their descendants among the peoples./All who see them will recognize/_that they are a people blessed by the Lord.

18854.text: ¶I surely rejoice in the Lord;/_my heart is joyful because of my God,/_because he has clothed me with clothes of victory,/_wrapped me in a robe of righteousness/_like a bridegroom in a priestly crown,/_and like a bride adorned in jewelry.

18855.text: /As the earth puts out its growth,/_and as a garden grows its seeds,/_so the Lord God will grow righteousness and praise before all the nations.

18856.text: §¶For Zion’s sake I won’t keep silent,/_and for Jerusalem’s sake I won’t sit still/_until her righteousness shines out like a light,/_and her salvation blazes like a torch.

18857.text: /Nations will see your righteousness,/_all kings your glory./You will be called by a new name,/_which the Lord’s own mouth will determine.

18858.text: /You will be a splendid garland in the Lord’s hand,/_a royal turban in the palm of God’s hand.

18859.text: /You will no longer be called Abandoned,/_and your land will no longer be called Deserted./Instead, you will be called My Delight Is in Her,/_and your land, Married./_Because the Lord delights in you,/_your land will be cared for once again.

18860.text: /As a young man marries a young woman,/_so your sons will marry you./_With the joy of a bridegroom because of his bride,/_so your God will rejoice because of you.

18861.text: ¶Upon your walls, Jerusalem,/_I have appointed sentinels./Continually, all day and all night,/_they won’t keep silent./You who call on the Lord, don’t rest,

18862.text: /_and don’t allow God to rest/_until he establishes Jerusalem,/_and makes it the praise of the earth.

18863.text: /The Lord has promised/_with raised hand and strong arm:/_I will never again give your grain/_as food for your enemies./_Foreigners won’t drink your wine/_for which you labored.

18864.text: /Those who harvest will eat it/_and will praise the Lord;/_those who gather will drink it/_in my holy courtyards.

18865.text: ¶Pass through, pass through the gates;/_prepare the way for the people!/Build, build the road;/_clear away the stones!/_Raise up a signal for the peoples.

18866.text: /This is what the Lord announced/_to the earth’s distant regions:/Say to Daughter Zion, “Look! Your deliverer arrives,/_bringing reward and payment!”

18867.text: /They will be called The Holy People,/_Redeemed By the Lord./And you will be called Sought After—/_A City That Is Not Abandoned.

18868.text: §¶Who is this coming from Edom,/_from Bozrah in bright red garments,/_this splendidly dressed one, striding with great power?/_It is I, proclaiming righteousness, powerful to save!

18869.text: /Why is your clothing red,/_and your garments like those of one who stomps on grapes?

18870.text: /I have pressed out in the vat by myself—from the peoples, no one was with me./_I stomped on them in my anger,/_trampled them in my wrath./Their blood splashed on my garments,/_and stained all my clothing,

18871.text: /_because I intended a day of vengeance;/_the year of my deliverance had arrived.

18872.text: /I looked and found no helper;/_I was astonished to find no supporter./But my arm brought victory for me;/_my wrath helped me.

18873.text: /I trampled down nations in my anger/_and made them drunk on my wrath;/_I spilled their blood on the ground.

18874.text: §¶I will recount the Lord’s faithful acts;/_I will sing the Lord’s praises,/_because of all the Lord did for us,/_for God’s great favor toward the house of Israel./_God treated them compassionately/_and with deep affection.

18875.text: /God said, “Truly, they are my people,/_children who won’t do what is wrong.”/_God became their savior.

18876.text: /During all their distress, God also was distressed,/_so a messenger who served him saved them./In love and mercy God redeemed them,/_lifting and carrying them throughout earlier times.

18877.text: /But they rebelled,/_and made God’s holy spirit terribly sad,/_so that he turned into their enemy—/_he fought against them!

18878.text: ¶Then they remembered earlier times,/_when he rescued his people./Where was the one who drew them up from the sea,/_the shepherd of the flock?/Where was the one who put within them his holy spirit;

18879.text: /_the one who guided Moses’ strong hand/_with his glorious arm;/_who split the water for them/_to create an enduring reputation for himself,

18880.text: /_and who guided them through the depths?/_Like a horse in the desert, they didn’t stumble.

18881.text: /Like cattle descending to the valley,/_the Lord’s spirit brought them to rest./In this way you led your people/_and made for yourself a glorious reputation.

18882.text: ¶Look down from heaven and see,/_from your holy and glorious perch./Where are your energy and your might,/_your concern and your pity?/_Don’t hold back!

18883.text: /You are surely our father,/_even though Abraham doesn’t know us,/_and Israel doesn’t recognize us./You, Lord, are our father;/_your reputation since long ago is that of our redeemer.

18884.text: /Why do you lead us astray, Lord,/_from your ways?/Why do you harden our heart/_so we don’t fear you?/Return for the sake of your servants/_the tribes that are your heritage!

18885.text: /Why did the wicked bring down your holy place?/_Why did our enemies trample your sanctuary?

18886.text: /For too long we have been like those you don’t rule,/_like those not known by your name.

18887.text: ¶If only you would tear open the heavens and come down!/_Mountains would quake before you

18888.text: /_like fire igniting brushwood or making water boil./If you would make your name known to your enemies,/_the nations would tremble in your presence.

18889.text: ¶When you accomplished wonders beyond all our expectations;/_when you came down, mountains quaked before you.

18890.text: /From ancient times,/_no one has heard,/_no ear has perceived,/_no eye has seen any god but you/_who acts on behalf of those who wait for him!

18891.text: /You look after those who gladly do right;/_they will praise you for your ways./But you were angry when we sinned;/_you hid yourself when we did wrong.

18892.text: /We have all become like the unclean;/_all our righteous deeds are like a menstrual rag./All of us wither like a leaf;/_our sins, like the wind, carry us away.

18893.text: /No one calls on your name;/_no one bothers to hold on to you,/_for you have hidden yourself from us,/_and have handed us over to our sin.

18894.text: ¶But now, Lord, you are our father./_We are the clay, and you are our potter./_All of us are the work of your hand.

18895.text: /Don’t rage so fiercely, Lord;/_don’t hold our sins against us forever,/_but gaze now on your people, all of us:

18896.text: /_Your holy cities have become a wilderness;/_Zion has become a wilderness, Jerusalem a wasteland.

18897.text: /Our holy, glorious house,/_where our ancestors praised you,/_has gone up in flames;/_all that we treasured has become a ruin.

18898.text: /After all this, will you hold back, Lord?/_Will you keep silent and torment us so terribly?

18899.text: §¶I was ready to respond to those who didn’t ask./_I was ready to be found by those who didn’t look for me./I said, “I’m here! I’m here!” to a nation/_that didn’t call on my name.

18900.text: /I extended my hands all day/_to a rebellious people/_walking in a way that isn’t good,/_following their own plans;

18901.text: /_people who provoke me to my face continually,/_sacrificing in gardens and burning incense on bricks,

18902.text: /_who sit in tombs/_and spend the night among rocks;/_who eat swine’s flesh/_with broth of unclean meat in their bowls;

18903.text: /_who say, “Keep to yourself!/_Keep away from me! I’m too holy for you.”/These people ignite my anger/_like a fire that burns all day.

18904.text: /Look, this stands written before me./_I won’t be silent, but I will repay;/_I will repay in full measure

18905.text: /_your sins and the sins of your ancestors as well,/_says the Lord./Since they burned incense on the mountains,/_and mocked me in the hills,/I will count out to them/_full payment for their actions.

18906.text: ¶The Lord proclaims:/As new wine is found in the grape cluster,/_and someone says, “Don’t destroy it, for there is a blessing in it,”/_so I will do for the sake of my servants/_and not destroy everything:

18907.text: /I will bring out offspring from Jacob,/_and from Judah, heirs to my mountains./My chosen ones will take possession;/_my servants will dwell there.

18908.text: /Sharon will become a pasture for sheep,/_and the Achor Valley a resting place for cattle,/_for my people who seek me.

18909.text: /But you who abandon the Lord,/_who forget my holy mountain,/_who set a table for a god of good fortune,/_and fill cups of mixed wine for a god of fate:

18910.text: /_I will offer you to the sword./_You will all bow down for slaughter,/_because I called and you didn’t answer;/_I spoke and you wouldn’t hear./_You did what I considered evil,/_and chose what I didn’t want.

18911.text: /Therefore, the Lord God says:/_Look, my servants will eat, but you will hunger./_My servants will drink, but you will thirst./_My servants will rejoice, but you will be ashamed.

18912.text: /_My servants will sing with contented hearts,/_but you will cry out from heartache;/_with broken spirits you will wail.

18913.text: /You will leave your name behind for my chosen ones to curse:/_“May the Lord God kill you!/_May he call his servants by a different name!”

18914.text: /Those who pronounce a blessing in the land/_will do so by the God called Amen;/_those who make a solemn pledge in the land will do so by the God called Amen./Past troubles will be forgotten/_and hidden from my sight.

18915.text: §¶Look! I’m creating a new heaven and a new earth:/_past events won’t be remembered;/_they won’t come to mind.

18916.text: /Be glad and rejoice forever/_in what I’m creating,/_because I’m creating Jerusalem as a joy/_and her people as a source of gladness.

18917.text: /I will rejoice in Jerusalem and be glad about my people./_No one will ever hear the sound of weeping or crying in it again.

18918.text: /No more will babies live only a few days,/_or the old fail to live out their days./The one who dies at a hundred will be like a young person,/_and the one falling short of a hundred will seem cursed.

18919.text: /They will build houses and live in them;/_they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

18920.text: /They won’t build for others to live in,/_nor plant for others to eat./Like the days of a tree will be the days of my people;/_my chosen will make full use of their handiwork.

18921.text: /They won’t labor in vain,/_nor bear children to a world of horrors,/_because they will be people blessed by the Lord,/_they along with their descendants.

18922.text: /Before they call, I will answer;/_while they are still speaking, I will hear.

18923.text: /Wolf and lamb will graze together,/_and the lion will eat straw like the ox,/_but the snake—its food will be dust./They won’t hurt or destroy at any place on my holy mountain,/_says the Lord.

18924.text: §¶The Lord says:/Heaven is my throne,/_and earth is my footstool./So where could you build a house for me,/_and where could my resting place be?

18925.text: /My hand made all these things/_and brought them into being, says the Lord./But here is where I will look:/_to the humble and contrite in spirit,/_who tremble at my word.

18926.text: ¶The one who slaughters an ox kills a person;/_the one who sacrifices a sheep breaks a dog’s neck;/_the one who makes a grain offering offers swine’s blood;/_the one who burns incense blesses an idol./_All these have chosen their own ways,/_and prefer their detestable things.

18927.text: /So I too will choose to punish them,/_to bring horrors upon them,/_since I called and no one answered./_I spoke and no one heard,/_but they did evil in my eyes./_What I didn’t want, they chose.

18928.text: ¶Listen to the Lord’s word,/_you who tremble at his word:/Your family members, those who hate and exclude you because of my name,/_have said, “Let the Lord be glorified;/_let’s see your joy.”/_But they will be ashamed.

18929.text: /The sound of an uproar from the city! A sound from the temple!/_The sound of the Lord repaying his enemies what they have earned.

18930.text: §¶Before she was in labor, she gave birth./_Before her pangs came upon her, she delivered a boy.

18931.text: /Whoever heard of such a thing?/_Whoever saw such things as these?/Can a land come to birth in one day?/_Can a nation be born all at once?/Yet as soon as birth pangs came,/_Zion bore her children.

18932.text: /Will I open the womb and not bring to birth? says the Lord./_Will I, who create life, close the womb? says your God.

18933.text: /Celebrate with Jerusalem; be happy with her,/_all you who love her!/Rejoice with her in joy,/_all you who mourn over her,

18934.text: /_so that you may nurse and be satisfied/_from her comforting breasts,/_that you may drink and be refreshed/_from her full breasts.

18935.text: /The Lord says:/_Look, I’m extending prosperity to her like a river,/_and the wealth of nations like an overflowing stream./You will nurse and be carried on the hip/_and bounced upon the knee.

18936.text: ¶As a mother comforts her child,/_so I will comfort you;/_in Jerusalem you will be comforted.

18937.text: /When you see this, your heart will rejoice;/_your entire being will flourish like grass./The Lord’s power will be known among his servants,/_but his fury among his enemies.

18938.text: /The Lord will come with fire,/_God’s chariots like a windstorm,/_to repay in hot anger,/_to rebuke with fiery flames.

18939.text: /With fire and with sword the Lord will judge all humanity;/_many will be slain by the Lord.

18940.text: ¶Those who became holy and purify themselves, following their leader into the gardens, who eat pork, detestable animals, and mice, will meet their end together, says the Lord.

18941.text: §¶Because of their actions and thoughts, I’m coming to gather all nations and cultures. They will come to see my glory.

18942.text: I will put a sign on them, by sending out some of the survivors to the nations, to Tarshish, Libya, and Lydia, and to the archers of Cilicia and Greece—distant coastlands that haven’t heard of my fame or seen my glory. They will declare my glory among the nations.

18943.text: They will bring your family members from all nations as an offering to the Lord—on horses, in chariots, in wagons, on mules, and on camels—to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says the Lord, like Israelites bringing an offering in purified containers to the Lord’s house.

18944.text: I will select some of them as priests and Levites, says the Lord.

18945.text: ¶As the new heavens and the new earth that I’m making will endure before me, says the Lord,/_so your descendants and your name will endure.

18946.text: /From month to month and from Sabbath to Sabbath,/_all humanity will come to worship me, says the Lord.

18947.text: /They will go out and see the corpses/_of the people who rebelled against me,/_where their worm never dies, where their fire is never extinguished./_They will be a horror to everyone.
